subject: Physical Fitness
title: The YMCA Revolution
description: A micro-lesson that makes The YMCA Revolution usable.

hook.text: The YMCA started as a Bible study group in London. It became the world's largest fitness organization.

buildup.text: Founded in 1844, the YMCA added gymnasiums, swimming pools, and fitness programs to attract young men.

discovery.text: Basketball and volleyball were both invented at YMCAs â€” created specifically as indoor winter exercises.

twist.text: The YMCA democratized fitness. For the first time, working-class people had access to training facilities.

climax.text: By the 1920s, YMCAs operated in 50+ countries. They proved fitness could be community-driven and accessible.

punchline.text: A Bible study group invented basketball and made fitness available to everyone.
